subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In Korean [[hanja]] and Traditional Chinese, an additional {{l|mul|丶}} stroke is written at the bottom right corner of {{l|mul|耂}} above {{l|mul|日}}, which is the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}. In other regions, the additional {{l|mul|丶}} stroke has been omitted. * Three {{w|CJK compatibility ideographs}} exist for this character: ** U+FAB2: Alternative form used in North Korea without additional {{l|mul|丶}} stroke below {{l|mul|耂}}. ** U+FA5B: Japanese [[kyūjitai]] with additional {{l|mul|丶}} stroke below {{l|mul|耂}}. ** U+2F97A: Variant traditional form used in Taiwan with additional {{l|mul|丶}} stroke below {{l|mul|耂}}.
